title: Ticket #6884: Do not perform a network turnaround for each file transfer
description:
Turns out that HTCondor's file transfer performs a network turnaround (roundtrip communication between shadow and starter) for each file transferred by File Transfer. This is really unfortunate as it hurts network throughput due to i) latency (esp if submit and execute host are separated by the WAN), and ii) by preventing the TCP window from filling up, esp if many small files are being transferred.

Prior to any command sent by the file transfer object, the object will check to see if it needs a go-ahead from its peer.

The condor_starter gives a "go-ahead always", meaning that the shadow never again waits. The condor_shadow gives a "go-ahead once", meaning the transfers between the shadow and starter requires a round trip between peers to finish.

If condor_shadow is configured to not limit transfers (MAX_CONCURRENT_UPLOADS=0 or MAX_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS=0), then it will always send a "go-ahead always" without acquiring a transfer token. Additionally, the condor_shadow will send a "go-ahead always" after it has acquired the token only if MAX_CONCURRENT_UPLOADS=0. This appears to be dead code as, in this case, the shadow never acquires the token!

Currently, once a transfer token is received, the shadow never relinquishes it and it does not appear to expire. Accordingly, it appears the starter always requests a go-ahead and the shadow provides one unconditionally without contacting the schedd.

This setup appears to serve no purpose. We should have the shadow send a "go-ahead always" once it gets the transfer token. I believe this change is of minimal risk: if, in the future, we decide the token should be a lease (or go back to the "go-ahead once" behavior), the change is shadow-side only.
remarks:
2019-Jan-30 14:31:19 by tannenba:
Perhaps this patch should be merged into v8.8?

2019-Jan-30 14:33:36 by bbockelm:
A backport wouldn't be a bad idea. Just to be conservative, my preference would be to wait until we have a 8.9.x with this that CHTC is happy with.

I consider this a 9-year-old bug given that code exists to make this asynchronous already -- but the code was unreachable! Hence, it's a late-coming bugfix.

2019-Jan-31 16:40:44 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Patch looks good. I confirmed it works as expected; in the ShadowLog immediately after receiving the transfer token from the schedd: 

   Sending GoAhead for 127.0.0.1 to receive C:\condor\test\first_file.sub

With the patch it now says: 

   Sending GoAhead for 127.0.0.1 to receive C:\condor\test\first_file.sub and all further files.

Also confirmed by inspecting shadowlog and starterlog with D_NETWORK enabled that there are no longer any network turnarounds between each file being sent. Woot!

Only comments are:

  1. Needs an entry in the version history (I'll add that).
  2. For such a simple/small patch, suggest in the future just pushing to master branch in git instead of creating a topic branch.
  3. Upon release if HTCondor v8.9.1 (i.e. after surviving beta testing), I think this patch should be backported to the stable series.
  4. Would be great to take some measurements of the performance improvement resulting from this patch (perhaps by simulating some WAN latency)
